mva2.adapter

Class ListSection<M>

  • java.lang.Object
    • mva2.adapter.Section
      • mva2.adapter.ListSection<M>

  • public class ListSection<M>
extends Section
    Internally section uses DiffUtil to calculate the diff and calls the correct notify method.

    • Constructor Summary

      No arg constructor for ListSection.

      Constructor which initializes the ListSection with give PayloadProvider.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListSection

        public ListSection()
        No arg constructor for ListSection. This initializes the list section with default PayloadProvider which checks the equality using Object.equals(object)

      • ListSection

        public ListSection(PayloadProvider<M> payloadProvider)
        Constructor which initializes the ListSection with give PayloadProvider.
        Parameters:
        payloadProvider - PayloadProvider to be used by the list section.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(M item)
        Appends the specified element to the end of ListSection. Also calls RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's add animation.
        Parameters:
        item - element to be appended to this list
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the add operation is not supported by this ListSection

      • add

        public void add(int index,
                M item)
        Inserts the specified element at the specified position in this data manger (optional operation). Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (adds one to their indices). Also calls RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's add animation.
        Parameters:
        index - index at which the specified element is to be inserted
        item - element to be inserted
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the add operation is not supported by this data manger
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index > size())

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(java.util.Collection<? extends M> items)
        Appends all of the elements in the specified collection to the end of this ListSection, in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's iterator (optional operation). The behavior of this operation is undefined if the specified collection is modified while the operation is in progress. (Note that this will occur if the specified collection is this list, and it's nonempty) Also calls RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's add animation.
        Parameters:
        items - collection containing elements to be added to this list
        Returns:
        true if this list changed as a result of the call
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the addAll operation is not supported by this ListSection
        See Also:
        add(Object)

      • addAll

        public boolean addAll(int index,
                      java.util.Collection<? extends M> items)
        Inserts all of the elements in the specified collection into this data manager at the specified position (optional operation). Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (increases their indices). The new elements will appear in this list in the order that they are returned by the specified collection's iterator. The behavior of this operation is undefined if the specified collection is modified while the operation is in progress. Also calls RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's add animation.
        Parameters:
        index - index at which to insert the first element from the specified collection
        items - collection containing elements to be added to this list
        Returns:
        true if this data manager changed as a result of the call
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the addAll operation is not supported by this data manager

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all of the elements from this data manager (optional operation). The data manager will be empty after this call returns. After the elements are removed RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's remove animation will be called.

      • clearSelections

        public void clearSelections()
        This method is used to clear the selected items in a ListSection

      • get

        public M get(int index)
        Returns the element at the specified position in this list section.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the element to return
        Returns:
        the element at the specified position in this list section
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • getData

        public java.util.List<M> getData()
        Returns the data added to this section
        Returns:
        List of models added to this section

      • getSelectedItems

        public java.util.List<M> getSelectedItems()
        Returns the list of selected items
        Returns:
        List of selected items or empty list if none was selected

      • remove

        public void remove(int index)
        Removes the element at the specified position in this list (optional operation). Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices). If the element is removed RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's remove animation will be called.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the element to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • set

        public void set(java.util.List<M> items)
        Replaces the data list in this data manager with the new list. Also calls necessary RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's animation with payload.
        Parameters:
        items - list to be stored in the data manager

      • set

        public void set(int index,
                M item)
        Replaces the element at the specified position in this data manager with the specified element (optional operation). Also calls necessary RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's animation with payload.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the element to replace
        item - element to be stored at the specified position
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the set operation is not supported by this data manager
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= size())

      • setDiffUtil

        public void setDiffUtil(MvaDiffUtil<M> diffUtil)
        Sets the diffutil for this section. The default diffutil used in the adapter takes leverage of the payload provider of this section. If you want to customize the entire behaviour of calculating the diff, create your own implementation of MvaDiffUtil and set it here
        Parameters:
        diffUtil - DiffUtil to be used by the section

      • setOnItemClickListener

        public void setOnItemClickListener(OnItemClickListener<M> itemClickListener)
        Set the listener to get callback when an item is clicked inside the section. To invoke this listener, you need to call ItemViewHolder.onClick()
        Parameters:
        itemClickListener - Listener to be set

      • setOnSelectionChangedListener

        public void setOnSelectionChangedListener(OnSelectionChangedListener<M> selectionChangedListener)
        Set listener to get callback when an item is selected or unselected
        Parameters:
        selectionChangedListener - Listener to be set

      • setPayloadProvider

        public void setPayloadProvider(PayloadProvider<M> payloadProvider)
        Set your own payload provider. You can write your own implementation of the PayloadProvider and set it here.
        Parameters:
        payloadProvider - PayloadProvider to be set

      • setSwipeToDismissListener

        public void setSwipeToDismissListener(SwipeToDismissListener<M> swipeToDismissListener)
        Sets the SwipeToDismissListener
        Parameters:
        swipeToDismissListener - Listener to be set
        See Also:
        SwipeToDismissListener

      • size

        public int size()
        Removes all of the elements from this data manager (optional operation). The data manager will be empty after this call returns. After the elements are removed RecyclerView.ItemAnimator's remove animation will be called.
